title: Christian Reformists
text:
The Christian Reformists ("Cristiano Riformisti", CR) are a <a href="christian%20democracy">Christian-democratic</a> faction within <a href="New%20Centre-Right">New Centre-Right</a> (NCD), a <a href="list%20of%20political%20parties%20in%20Italy">political party in Italy</a>.
The group emerged as a faction within <a href="National%20Alliance%20%28Italy%29">National Alliance</a> (AN), a <a href="conservatism">conservative</a> party. Its founders included <a href="Antonio%20Mazzochi">Antonio Mazzochi</a> (ex-<a href="Christian%20Democracy%20%28Italy%29">DC</a>), <a href="Erder%20Mazzocchi">Erder Mazzocchi</a> (ex-DC) and <a href="Pietro%20Armani">Pietro Armani</a> (ex-<a href="Italian%20Republican%20Party">PRI</a>). The main goal of CR was the admission of the party into the <a href="European%20People%27s%20Party">European People's Party</a> (EPP).
In March 2009 the CR, along with the whole AN, joined <a href="The%20People%20of%20Freedom">The People of Freedom</a> (PdL).
In September 2008 the <a href="Christian-Social%20European%20Union">Christian-Social European Union</a>, a Christian-democratic association led by <a href="Gennaro%20Castiello">Gennaro Castiello</a> (a former member of the <a href="Christian%20Democratic%20Refoundation">Christian Democratic Refoundation</a>) which had joined the PdL in April 2008, merged into the Christian Reformists, opening the way to a 40,000 members-strong "Catholic bloc".
In 2012, while still being part of the PdL, the faction presented its own lists in a few municipalities in <a href="Central%20Italy">Central Italy</a>, gaining a notable 10.5% in <a href="Ardea%2C%20Lazio">Ardea</a>, <a href="Lazio">Lazio</a>.
In November 2013 the CR left the PdL and joined NCD.
